lines.text: I can't believe that you're a stewardess.
Actually I'm not, I'm a skyjacker in a drag.
Oh, that's reassuring, just give your name and I report you to the proper authorities when we land.
Jemima
And I'm Uncle Ben...
I'm serious, that's really my name... Jemima Brown, my mother was hooked on being ethnic.
Or else turned on by a pancake. As long as we both agree that it's to much for a black chick to have the name of Jemima.
Well I don't know, I mean people don't forget you when you name is Jemima.
I don't think people would forget you if your name was Alfred.
You still here?
Now really, you don't expect me to just walk out that door, do you, sweetheart?
Door or window, it's your choice.
[Hemlock throws Pope out of his office]
Don't for get your trench coat. How's anybody gonna recognize you without your disguise?
I was expecting you before this. Mr. Dragon does not like to be kept waiting.
Oh, the impatient albino.
I don't think Mr. Dragon's affliction is a joking matter.
I thought it was rather humorous, myself. A spy network being run by a bloodless freak who can't stand light or cold.
Or germs. Are you healthy?
Should I turn my head and cough?
No known infections?
Nothing other than the usual, syphilis, running sores, and the clap.

It's dangerous, child, to come to conclusions when you don't have any facts. Now let me lay some on you. Sure Dragon knows what he's doing, just like he knew what he was doing when he worked for the Nazis during World War II.
What?

Oh, you didn't know that, did you? Yes your "wrap him up in red, white, and blue" Mr. Dragon's a goddamn Hessian, that's what he is. And he'd sell out the other side as fast as he'd sell out our side. And he'd sell out his mother, too, if the bloodless freak had one.

You think it's so awful the other side has a germ formula? It's against the Geneva Convention, isn't it, and they stole it from us. Well what the hell are we doing with it in the first place? We're not supposed to have one either.
And you don't see any difference between their side and our side?
Yeah, I see a difference. But as long as we have Dragon and Pope working for us, how bad can the other side be?
You betrayed the both of us in Asia, and we lived, no thanks to you. Now you people have killed Henri in Zurich.
I didn't actually kill him, you know.
Well I probably won't *actually* kill you.
That's very little comfort.
Is this hotel always so crowded?
Only when there's a climb. Then the Eiger birds start flocking in.
Eiger birds?
Yeah, jet setters, assorted zombies, come here to watch a climb. If they're lucky, they get to see a man die on the mountain.
That's grim.
So's the Eiger.
What got into Jean-Paul?
I don't know. A little jumpy, I guess.
You been jumping his wife?
No, why?
You sure?
Well, I think it's something I'd know.
Search Division has drawn a blank on the target. All we know is he's here somewhere.
Miles Mellough knew who it was.
He did? Did he tell you?
He offered to, but the price was too high.
Well, what'd he want, then?
To live.

Pope, I really don't mind you being an asshole, you really can't help that, but I do mind you lying to me like I was a fool. Now you came here with one thought in mind, and that was to attach yourself to me so the target would know who I am and what I am. Now, who's gonna perform this sanction if he gets me? You?
You don't think I can handle it?
In a locked closet with a grenade.
[Hemlock saves Meier from falling off the mountain]
You're very good. I have really enjoyed climbing with you.
We'll make it.
I don't think so. But we shall continue with style.

[after fighting and stepping on Popes hand]
Okay, you'll be alright now Pope. Of course you may have trouble playing the clarinet for awhile.
Are you busy this evening?
No.
You live alone?
My roommate's gone for the week.
Good. Then... go on home, break out the books and study your little ass off. That's the best way to maintain a "B" average. Don't study it all off.
[Referring to Hemlock's written assessment]
Crap?
Excuse me? You did just start this conversation off by saying crap didn't you?
[Hemlock strands Mellough in the middle of the desert]
Jonathan, you're not going to leave me out here? Oh, Jonathan, for chrissakes, kill me but don't leave me here!
[Bowman watches the climb through his telescope]
I say, old boy, are you using your scope? Do you mind if my wife has a peek.
Darling, tell him we'll pay for it.
We can pay for it, you know.
Get out of here. Either of you friggin' vampires ever touch this telescope, you're gonna need surgery to get it out of your ass!
Tell me, Mr. Bowman, in your opinion do these men climb to prove their manhood, or is it more a matter of compensating for inferiority feelings?
Lady, why don't you go get yourself screwed. It would do you a lot of good.

[Hemlock has walked in while Dragon is hooked up to a transfusion device]
Forgive me, Dr. Hemlock. Twice a year I have to have my blood completely replaced.

[through gritted teeth]
With what?
I've never felt this close to art before.
How nice.
But I have a problem.
How terrible.

If I don't keep my "B" average, I'll lose my scholarship and I don't think I'll do well on your final exam. I've gained a while new feeling about art but sometimes you can't put your true feelings down on paper.
How true.
For what I want in this world, I would even sell out my dear mother.
How true!
Why did she do it?
Oldest reason in the world.
Love?
Money!

[to his class]
Some of you will continue in your education. Some of you will continue with your interest in art. Some of you will have interests other than that. If we've learned nothing else this year, I hope you've learned the stupidity of the statement that art belongs to the world. 'Cause art belongs to the cultivated who can appreciate it. The majority of the great unwashed does not fit into this category... and neither, I'm sorry to say, do most of you.
My superior wants to see you.

[sarcastically]
Well, that doesn't limit the field much!
Friends? Enemies? Where do I fit in?
I'm sorry, but you don't. Here's to the selfish killer and the patriotic whore! Do you have anything else to say? I usually keep a twenty in the bowl by the door. You might pick it up on the way out!
I consider it self-defeating to plan in terms of retreat.
I consider it stupid not to.
Wanna Beer?
You gonna call room service?
We got beer.
If you hauled beer up this rock you're insane!
I may be insane, but I'm not stupid. I didn't carry it, you did! It's in your pack.
Christ, I ought'a throw you off this pillar! Besides, it's warm.
Oh I'm sorry, I thought you'd draw the line on haulin' ice.
However you never know. Sometimes people do things they thought they'd never do again. Like rape, for instance. Yeah I thought I'd given up rape but I've changed my mind.

[sitting in his dark lair]
Even the slightest direct light causes me intense pain.
Does your physical disability preclude you from coming to the point?
Fasten your seat belt, sir.
Oh, I have no intention of trying to escape.
They kill one of ours, we kill the killers. No purpose at all, just barbaric.
You're getting religion a little late.
I didn't quit because of religion, I quit because of mathematics.
Oh?
That's right. The odds are stacking up against me. Assassins who stay too long wind up getting assassinated, and that ain't in my game plan.
You know what? Way down deep you've got the makings of a real bad ass. I don't know that I'd like to be alone on a desert island with you if there was a shortage of food.
No worry, you're a friend.
You ever had any enemies?
A few.
Any of them still around?
[last lines]
You know that art collection of mine's not going to get any bigger, but I'd sure like to have you take a long look at it.
I thought you'd never ask. I'll get two tickets. Jonathan, you can tell me. You didn't really sanction all three of them, did you?
[just a long hard look]
And why am I the only one who can perform this sanction?
First, do you accept the assignment?
Yes, I accept!
the target is male, he is an accomplished mountain climber. We learned this from a note we intercepted. Also, a witness said he limped.
Well, that's fine. Now all I have to do is kill every mountain climber with a sore foot.
Not quite. Our man will be involved in a climb in the Alps this summer.
Oh, you're getting warm now, Dragon. That narrows it down to three or four thousand men.
Fewer than that. We know which mountain he will climb.
And?
The Eiger!
He looks like he could change a nine-dollar bill in threes.

[laughing]
A joke... a bitter Hemlock.
john, do what I tell you. cut the rope above you!
Shabby research I can stand, but involuted style really makes my ass drag!
This is were I turn back.
Thank God.
Not you, you need the work. George there will take you on up.
It's a girl.
A lot of people notice that.
the Eiger sanction.
